item.title: Dani add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "There are few people whom I really love, and still fewer of whom I think well. The more I see of the world, the more am I dissatisfied with it; and every day confirms my belief of the inconsistency of all human characters, and of the little dependence that can be placed on the appearance of merit or sense." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Dani add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The more I know of the world, the more I am convinced that I shall never see a man whom I can really love. I require so much!" -- Jane Austen

item.title: Dani add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "What are men to rocks and mountains?" -- Jane Austen

item.title: Dani add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "There is nothing I would not do for those who are really my friends. I have no notion of loving people by halves, it is not my nature." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Dani add a quote by Donald Miller
item.description: "And if these mountains had eyes, they would wake to find two strangers in their fences, standing in admiration as a breathing red pours its tinge upon earth's shore. These mountains, which have seen untold sunrises, long to thunder praise but stand reverent, silent so that man's weak praise should be given God's attention." -- Donald Miller

item.title: Dani add a quote by Donald Miller
item.description: "Everybody has to leave, everybody has to leave their home and come back so they can love it again for all new reasons." -- Donald Miller

item.title: Dani add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Never trust anyone who has not brought a book with them." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Dani add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "No matter who you are, no matter where you live, and no matter how many people are chasing you, what you don't read is often as important as what you do read." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Dani add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Fate is like a strange, unpopular restaurant filled with odd little waiters who bring you things you never asked for and don't always like." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Dani add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Taking oneâ€™s chances is like taking a bath, because sometimes you end up feeling comfortable and warm, and sometimes there is something terrible lurking around that you cannot see until it is too late and you can do nothing else but scream and cling to a plastic duck." -- Lemony Snicket
